means: 学徒，徒弟( apprentice的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I was apprenticed to a builder when I was fourteen.
sentence.Network_cn: 14岁时，我拜一个建筑工人为师当学徒。

sentence.Network_en: Lucius got apprenticed to a stonemason.
sentence.Network_cn: 卢修斯成了石匠的学徒。

sentence.Network_en: When I was old enough, I was to be apprenticed to Joe.
sentence.Network_cn: 等我达到了一定的年龄, 就可以跟乔做学徒.

entry.def: An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill.

example.ex: I started off as an apprentice and worked my way up...
example.tran: 我从学徒开始干起，逐步上升。

example.ex: He left school at 15 and trained as an apprentice carpenter.
example.tran: 他15岁辍学，当上木工学徒。

entry.def: If a young person is apprenticed to someone, they go to work for them in order to learn their skill.

example.ex: I was apprenticed to a builder when I was fourteen.
example.tran: 14岁时，我拜一个建筑工人为师当学徒。

auth_sentence.content: Morgan apprenticed himself to an experienced doctor; there was no other way of studying medicine.
